form.name: how_often_to_breastfeed
form.page_subtitle: PNC Counselling: Infant Feeding> How Often to Breastfeed

field.name: How often should a client breastfeed:
Breastfeed your baby on demand, day and night, at least 8 – 12 times everyday
Frequent feeding will help your body to produce breast milk
Continue to feed until baby finishes the breast and comes off on his or her own. Offer the other breast and let baby decide if he or she wants more or not

Switching back and forth from one breast to the other prevents the baby from getting the nutritious “hind milk.” The “fore milk” has more water and satisfies the baby’s thirst. The “hind milk” has more fat and satisfies your baby’s hunger
If your baby is ill or sleepy, wake him or her to offer breast often
Do NOT use bottles, teats or sprouted cups. They are difficult to clean and can cause your baby to become sick
